issue.title: Significant sensor data timestamp accuracy regression from Gazebo2 to Gazebo4

content.raw:
@Stefan_Kohlbrecher I tried out your minimal example and was able to reproduce the problem in `gazebo7` + `gazebo_ros_pkgs`  `indigo` branch. I see that you're using the `gazebo_ros_openni_kinect` plugin so I ported the changes in this [gazebo_ros_pkgs pull request 410](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/410) to the openni_kinect plugin and the timestamp problem is fixed for me. My changes are in the [camera_timestamp_indigo](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/tree/camera_timestamp_indigo) branch

Going forward, we should try and merge:

https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/410

and I'll make another pull request to fix the timestamp issue for other rendering cameras in `gazebo_ros_pkgs`

My changes are in the camera_timestamp_indigo branch
